intro: Calylophus hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and range in color from white to pink. Calylophus hartwegii is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a hardy species in desert ecosystems.
